thread.title: Paloma Faith announces 2018 UK arena tour including show in Newcastle

author: Simon Duke
title: Paloma Faith announces 2018 UK arena tour including show in Newcastle
text:
What's On Paloma Faith announces 2018 UK arena tour including show in Newcastle Paloma, the singer behind hits like New York and Only Love Can Hurt Like This, is touring in support of her fourth album The Architect Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get what's on   Thank you for subscribing!   
Three years after her first ever sell out show at the Metro Radio Arena , Paloma Faith will return to Newcastle for another gig at the famous concert venue. 
Paloma – one of only two British female artists this decade to have their last three albums go double platinum in the UK – will release her long-awaited fourth album, The Architect, on November 17 before bringing her 2018 UK Arena tour to the Metro Radio Arena Newcastle on Friday, March . 
The new album – her first in more than three years and since giving birth to her first child – features an array of acclaimed co-writers, producers and collaborators including: Sia, John Legend, Jesse Shatkin, TMS, Starsmith, Tobias Jesso Jr., Eg White, Rag’n’Bone Man, actor Samuel L. Jackson and journalist and activist Owen Jones. 
Paloma, who won the Brit Award for British Female Solo Artist in 2015 following the phenomenal success of her last record, 2014’s A Perfect Contradiction, explores both personal and political themes on the album. Read More Watch the video for Sam Smith's Too Good at Goodbyes which was filmed in Newcastle 
Whilst the music is classic Paloma – with sweeping orchestral tracks, smooth soul, sleek disco grooves and stomping electro pop all featured on the album – the lyrics raise social and political questions, and cover powerful and topical themes, such as motherhood, social anxiety, wealth inequality, technology’s impact on feelings of alienation…. oh and also the future of the Western world, Donald Trump, Brexit and the refugee crisis – all within the confines of classic pop. 
And as well as her new material, fans are sure to hear some real classics from the Paloma back catalogue like Only Love Can Heart Like This and Picking Up The Pieces. 
Tickets for Paloma’s Newcastle show will go on sale 9am Friday, September 29 and will be available online from Ticketmaster and Eventim , from the booking hotline number 0844 493 6666 or in person from the Metro Radio Arena Box Office. Like us on Facebook
